questions.question: You met Sam yesterday, ...................................?
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make question tags with did. We use a negative tag after an affirmative sentence.

questions.question: She can run a mile in 5 minutes, …………………………….?
The child recognized her grandparents instantly, …………………………………?
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make questions tags with did.

questions.question: The man sells fruits in a local market, …………………………………..?
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make question tags with do or does. Use do with plural subjects and use does with singular subjects.

questions.question: She said nothing, ……………………………………?
questions.description: Nothing is a negative word. Use an affirmative tag after it.

questions.question: Janet calls her parents every day, ………………………………..?
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make question tags with do or does.

questions.question: He has faced many setbacks in life, ………………………………..?
He is never late for work, ……………………………….?
questions.description: An affirmative tag is used after never.

questions.question: Help me, ……………………………………?
questions.description: After imperatives we use will you? or can't you? to ask people to do something.

questions.question: Come here, ……………………………?
questions.description: After imperatives we use will you? or can't you? to ask people to do something.

questions.question: There is hardly anything we can do, ………………………………..?
questions.description: An affirmative tag is used after hardly.
